Rules for personal baggage are eased, and the duty on goods for personal use is reduced to 10 percent. A trust-based customs regime with a single window system and AI integration is planned.

The program aims to balance energy security with environmental targets.

items.title: Hotter, drier February looms over India, putting winter crops at risk
items.summary: India faces a warmer and drier February after an unusually warm January. This weather pattern poses risks to key winter crops like wheat, rapeseed, and chickpeas. Higher temperatures could accelerate crop growth, leading to yield losses. This situation may increase India's reliance on imported cooking oils. Farmers have planted record areas of wheat and rapeseed.

items.title: Budget 2026: No allocation for Chabahar port project in Union Budget
items.summary: India has not allocated funds for the Chabahar port project in its Union Budget. This move comes as the US has imposed sanctions on Iran. India has been a major partner in developing the port. The US had granted a waiver on sanctions for Chabahar, which ends soon. India is discussing the project with the US.

items.title: Budget 2026 trims food, fertiliser and fuel subsidy outgo by 4.47% in FY27
items.summary: The government's annual subsidy expenditure on food, fertilizer, and fuel is projected to decrease by 4.47% to Rs 4,10,495 crore in FY27. This reduction is driven by lower estimates for food, fertilizer, and petroleum subsidies, with the Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Anna Yojana remaining a significant allocation for food support.

New dedicated freight corridors and 20 National Waterways will be operationalized. Coastal shipping and inland waterways will see increased usage. Seaplane manufacturing will also be promoted to enhance connectivity and tourism.

items.title: Explained: What STT hike on derivatives means for futures and options traders?
items.summary: Union Budget 2026 raised securities transaction tax on futures and options, increasing trading costs across India’s derivatives market. The move triggered a sharp sell off in brokerage and exchange stocks and renewed concerns over liquidity, volumes and foreign investor participation in one of the world’s largest F&O markets.

items.summary: Moody's Ratings described India's annual federal budget as tactical rather than a breakthrough. While planned fiscal consolidation will narrow the budget gap, it won't alter India's credit profile, as the deficit remains wider than pre-Covid levels. The agency affirmed India's stable outlook last year, citing economic strength and domestic funding.

This has caused concern as affordable housing sales have declined significantly since the pandemic. Increased allocations for Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana schemes aim to address housing needs across rural and urban areas.

The Union Budget 2026 proposes to double the individual shareholding limit to 10 per cent from 5 per cent. The aggregate ceiling has been raised to 24 per cent from 10 per cent.

Each CER will receive Rs 5,000 crore over five years for development plans, implemented through a competitive, results-based financing mechanism.

Inter-cooperative dividend income will now be deductible under the new tax regime if further distributed to members. An exemption is also provided for dividend income received by national cooperative federations on investments made up to January 31, 2026.

items.title: Budget 2025 vs 2026: How far has India come since the last money manual

This marks a clear departure from merely stabilizing the economy to fostering sustainable growth. Key areas of focus include enhancing infrastructure, supporting manufacturing industries, and elevating service exports. Agriculture undergoes subtle refinements, keeping productivity at the forefront.

Fiscal consolidation is marginal. The budget prioritizes stability amid strong growth. Major reforms like fertiliser subsidy abolition were avoided. Sector-specific measures are politically understandable but economically modest.

Bank of India saw the steepest fall, with all 12 Nifty PSU Bank index stocks trading lower. This move, part of the Viksit Bharat initiative, also includes restructuring of nonbank lenders, marking a rare Budget Sunday market session.

Foreign companies offering cloud services worldwide will receive a tax holiday until 2047. This benefit applies if they utilise data center services located within India. The move aims to attract global investment and bolster India's digital infrastructure.

This initiative aims to boost Indian small and medium enterprises for global competition. The plan focuses on equity, liquidity, and professional guidance. It seeks to transform smaller firms into export champions. This move supports India's trade ambitions amid global economic shifts.

items.title: Union Budget 2026: Centre aims at retaining states’ tax share at 41% for 2026–31
items.summary: Union Budget 2026" The Budget proposes to maintain states' share of central taxes at 41 percent for the next five years. This aligns with Finance Commission recommendations. The Centre will provide 1.40 lakh crore rupees as grants to states for FY27. This decision follows consultations with states, some of whom sought a higher tax share.

items.summary: The government proposed to raise the STT by more than 50% on futures to 0.05% from 0.02% and to 0.15% from 0.01% on options, raising concerns of a reduction in volumes.

items.title: Budget 2026: Aviation industry gets wings with duty-free manufacturing push
items.summary: Union Budget 2026: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced customs duty exemptions. These aim to boost domestic manufacturing in civil and defence aviation. The government will exempt duties on components for civilian training and other aircraft. Raw materials for defence aircraft parts will also see duty exemptions. These measures encourage local production and support India's aerospace and defence sector growth.

items.title: Budget 2026 proposes ₹20,000 crore for carbon capture utilisation and storage
items.summary: Carbon capture utilisation and storage or CCUS involves the capture of CO2, generally from large point sources like power generation or industrial facilities that use either fossil fuels or biomass as fuel

items.title: Sensex crashes 1,547 points, investors lose  ₹10 lakh crore amid budget, STT announcements— Why did the market fall?

items.title: Union Budget 2026: India raises overseas individual investment limits in equities under PIS
items.summary: The Budget 2026 allows non-resident Indians to invest in Indian equities via the Portfolio Investment Scheme, raising individual limits and the overall foreign holding cap. The move aims to deepen capital markets, broaden long-term inflows, and leverage global Indian participation, supported by evolving platforms such as GIFT City.

Indian Hotels, EIH, Lemon Tree and ITC Hotels gained, while Easy Trip Planners surged 9%. The budget’s focus on medical hubs, hospitality institutes, and coastal corridors supports long-term sector growth.

items.summary: Union Budget 2026: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman presented the India Budget. The Centre's debt-to-GDP ratio will decrease. Rs 5,000 crore is allocated for urban-led growth over five years. A scheme will develop the Buddhist circuit in the Northeast. Support will also be provided for manufacturing assistive devices.

items.summary: The Union Budget 2026-27 introduces dedicated initiatives for high-quality sports goods manufacturing and research. A scheme will revive 200 industrial clusters. The textile sector will see an integrated program focusing on fibre self-reliance, modernization, and handloom support. Samarth 2.0 aims to upgrade textile skilling. Mega textile parks will be established to boost production and value addition, particularly in technical textiles.

items.summary: Union Budget 2026: The India Budget prioritizes education and social infrastructure. Five university townships will be established near industrial hubs to foster industry-education links. Every district will get a girls' hostel, enhancing women's education and safety. Additionally, 15,000 secondary schools will receive content labs to boost creative and digital skills.

items.summary: Budget 2026: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced seven new high-speed rail corridors in the budget 2026-27, including routes connecting major cities like Mumbai, Pune, Hyderabad, Chennai, Delhi, and Varanasi. The government also plans to establish the East West Dedicated Freight Corridor, building on existing projects and aiming for greater indigenisation in future bullet train development.

A new initiative, Biopharma Shakti, with a Rs 10,000 crore outlay over five years, will boost domestic production of biologics and biosimilars. This strategy includes establishing 1,000 accredited clinical trial sites and upgrading NIPERs.

items.summary: Union Budget 2026: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced a significant initiative in the Union Budget 2026-27. The government will build one girls' hostel in every district across India. This move aims to enhance educational opportunities and provide secure living spaces for students. It will particularly benefit girls from rural and semi-urban areas.

Dixon Technologies, Kaynes Technology, PG Electroplast and peers gained as investors priced in higher domestic demand, stronger incentives and long term semiconductor manufacturing growth.

This move is part of a multi-year strategy for a sustained policy push.

The budget is set to strengthen manufacturing sectors, breathe new life into aging industries, and bolster support for MSMEs.

items.summary: Union Budget 2026: India's banking sector is strong with improved balance sheets and high profits. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced a high-level committee to review the system. This panel will chart the next phase of reform-led growth. It will also look at the role of Non-Banking Financial Companies. Public sector NBFCs will be restructured to improve efficiency and focus on key sectors.

Shares of Arvind, Vardhman Textiles, Trident, Raymond, Welspun India and KPR Mill surged as investors priced in stronger export competitiveness and long-term growth prospects for the sector.

Global developments in markets like China and Indonesia, coupled with US trade tariffs and de-dollarization trends, are driving price movements. Regulatory interventions are increasing to curb speculative excesses and ensure physical delivery.

items.title: Budget should prioritise manufacturing incentives to boost jobs and income: Nilesh Shah
items.summary: India's economic growth is shifting focus from consumption to manufacturing and investment.  Structural reforms have boosted consumption selectively. Income growth driven by manufacturing and exports will sustainably revive consumption.
